channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Netflix is making a Willy Wonka reality/competition show
Americans finally got a rule protecting their credit scores from unexpected medical debt. Now Trump is attacking the agency behind it
item.description: The policy to remove health-care bills from credit reporting must remain to protect patients from predatory billing practices.

item.title: Hamas Fires Rockets at Tel Aviv as Israel Expands Gaza Ground Operations
item.description: A two-month cease-fire in Gaza collapsed this week amid a renewed Israeli bombardment. The fighting now looks like it is escalating back to full-scale...

item.title: Europe Delays Tariffs on U.S. Whiskey to Make Time to Negotiate
item.description: The European trade commissioner said U.S. officials wanted to start negotiating only after a fresh set of Trump administration tariffs would take effe...

item.title: Ukraine Attacks Air Base Deep Inside Russia
item.description: The two sides traded strikes overnight as the Trump administration worked to hammer out the details of a partial cease-fire.

item.title: Trump’s Battles With Colleges Could Change American Culture for a Generation
item.description: Many in higher education worry Trump’s efforts to bend academia to his will could end American leadership in research and science. Universities are no...

item.title: Texas Senate passes two bills that would bring mandatory prayer time and the Ten Commandments into classrooms
item.description: Bill now goes to House of Representatives.

item.title: Republicans Once Championed Free Speech on Campus. Now, Not So Much.
item.description: President Trump and state politicians are pushing new laws and policies that crack down on curriculum, protests and speakers.

item.title: Jerome Powell doubles down on a word that has haunted him, saying pain from tariffs would be ‘transitory’
item.description: The Fed’s slowness to catch the inflation surge that began during the pandemic has earned it scads of criticism. Is this time different?

item.title: Trump wants to kill tax on tips. That could save Americans over $100 billion over the next decade—but experts warn it’ll make tipping culture so much worse
item.description: Waiters, valets, and baristas: Think you'll be better off now that Trump wants to kill tax on tips? Think again.

item.title: Violence Flares as Hindu Group Calls for Removal of Muslim Ruler’s Tomb
item.description: The tensions showed how right-wing Hindu leaders and organizations in India use historical grievances to fuel contemporary tensions.
